segments.content: With recent production deployments from Facebook and Twitter, I think a new trend is slowly growing: atomic CSS-in-JS.
segments.sourceMdx: With recent production deployments from Facebook and Twitter, I think a new trend is slowly growing: atomic CSS-in-JS.
segments.translated_content: 随着Facebook和Twitter近期在生产环境中的部署，我认为一个新趋势正在逐渐兴起：原子化CSS-in-JS方案。

segments.content: In this post, we'll see what atomic CSS is, how it relates to functional / utility-first CSS like TailwindCSS, and that big players are adopting it in their modern React codebases.
segments.sourceMdx: In this post, we'll see what atomic CSS is, how it relates to functional / utility-first CSS like TailwindCSS, and that big players are adopting it in their modern React codebases.
segments.translated_content: 本文将探讨原子化CSS的概念、其与TailwindCSS等功能优先/工具类优先CSS的关系，以及大型科技公司如何在其现代React代码库中采用该方案。

segments.content: As I'm not a expert of this subject, don't expect a deep dive about the pros and cons. I just hope you get an idea about what it's about.
segments.sourceMdx: As I'm not a expert of this subject, don't expect a deep dive about the pros and cons. I just hope you get an idea about what it's about.
segments.translated_content: 由于我并非该领域专家，本文不会深入探讨其优缺点，仅希望帮助读者建立基础认知。

segments.content: **Note**: Atomic CSS is not really related to [Atomic Design](https://atomicdesign.bradfrost.com/).
